meanings.sent1: The little tawpie kept making funny faces in class.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a tawpie and listen to your teacher.
meanings.sent3: The tawpie tried to juggle apples but ended up dropping them all.
meanings.sent4: Her brother always teased her for being a tawpie, but she didn't mind.
meanings.sent5: The tawpie's antics always brought laughter to the room.

meanings.definition: To act in a foolish or silly manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't tawpie around when we are trying to study.
meanings.sent2: He tends to tawpie when he is nervous.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to tawpie their way through the obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was tawpieing her way through the dance routine.
meanings.sent5: The comedian loved to tawpie on stage to make people laugh.
